page.title: 04CHANGING FARMING LANDSCAPE
page.content: LITTLE HAS CHANGED IN THE FARMING LANDSCAPE RECENTLY.A FEW OF THE THINGS THAT HAVE CHANGED ARE AS FOLLOWS:- THE MAIN CHANGES ARE OIL SEED RAPE IS NOW BEING GROWN. SINCE THERE ARE NOW MORE VARIETIES THERE IS A TYPE WHICH CAN BE GROWN IN THE SOIL TYPE AND LATITUDE OF THIS AREA. MUCH MORE WINTER BARLEY IS BEING GROWN.THE BIG FARMS GROW IT TO SPREAD OUT HARVESTING TIMES SO THAT THEY DO NOT HAVE TOO MUCH WORK AT ONE TIME. ALTHOUGH THIS CROP IS BEING GROWN MORE AND MORE IN THIS AREA, IT CAN ONLY BE USED FOR FEEDING. ALSO, THERE IS A BIGGER TONNAGE, THUS A BIGGER FARMING INCOME.MORE LAND IS BEING DEVELOPED BY THE COUNCIL FOR HOUSING. FINALLY, MORE LAND HAS BEEN PLOUGHED FOR ARABLE INSTEAD OF FOR CATTLE (DAIRY OR BREEDING).
